text:
In Russia, the law on autonomous Runet entered into force
01 Nov 2019, 07:53 by Victor Podvolotsky
Equipment for its execution is still being tested and not installed on networks.
On November 1, 2019, the Autonomous Runet Law entered into force. It provides for the creation of a national Internet traffic routing system. It should ensure the safe and stable functioning of the Internet in Russia, even if the country is completely disconnected from the global network.
The bill was submitted to the State Duma in December 2018. Formally, it represents amendments to the laws ‚ÄúOn Communications‚Äù and ‚ÄúOn Information, Information Technologies and the Protection of Information‚Äù.
The law requires operators to use technical means of countering threats (TSPU), which will allow filtering traffic and restricting access to prohibited sites. However, according to RBC, the necessary equipment is still being tested and not installed on networks.
Why this law is needed, what it will change and what threatens ordinary users, you can find out from a special article on Lifehacker.
